name: Tarla Dalal
description: is an Indian-born actress, food and travel writer, and television personality. She was born on August 13, 1933, in Delhi, India. Jaffrey is best known for her contributions to Indian cuisine, including her many cookbooks and television shows about Indian food.Jaffrey has written over 15 cookbooks, many of which focus on Indian cuisine, and has hosted several television shows on the subject. She has also acted in numerous films and television shows, both in India and the United States.

recipes_info.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
recipes_info.cooking_method:
1. Cook the spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente, about 8-10 minutes. Reserve 1 cup of the pasta water before draining the spaghetti.
2. While the spaghetti is cooking, cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon with a slotted spoon and set aside.
3. Add the garlic to the bacon grease and cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs and Parmesan cheese.
5. Add the cooked spaghetti to the skillet with the garlic and bacon grease. Toss to coat.
6. Remove the skillet from the heat and add the egg mixture, tossing quickly to coat the spaghetti. The heat from the spaghetti will cook the eggs, but be careful not to scramble them.
7. If the spaghetti seems dry, add some of the reserved pasta water to loosen it up.
8. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.
